title: Quest-Based Professional Language Proficiency Improvement Program: Integrated Speaking/Writing Training Focused on Medical/Legal Scenarios

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate language proficiency (integrated reading, listening, speaking, writing) and understanding of basic professional terminology (medical/legal/business). Basic ability to utilize digital resources (experience with language learning apps and online dictionaries).
context.additional_context: Learners use personal devices (tablets/smartphones) to access digital resources (language learning apps, online dictionaries, video materials) required for quest completion and collaborate with peers via real-time video conferencing tools. The program provides customized text analysis tools and vocabulary expansion features for specific professional fields, focusing on improving reading comprehension and expressive skills.

learning_goals: Learners will demonstrate situational language application skills (integrated speaking/writing and specialized terminology) by successfully completing 80% or more of quests based on real-world professional scenarios (medical/legal contexts).

By collaboratively designing and executing three or more customized language challenges with peers, learners will enhance creative problem-solving, collaborative expression, and domain-specific text analysis skills.

Based on self-directed learning records (one or more entries per week for grammar/vocabulary/pronunciation and three or more specialized terms) over four weeks, learners will write a 1,000-character report analyzing changes in language proficiency. They must achieve a "Distinguished" grade (4+/5-point scale) in four out of five reflective rubric items (writing, presentation, feedback, participation, self-assessment).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
